target_text: "But for the purpose of a definition, I would say quality takes place in the process level and the software level."

Agreed.justification: All roles (Software Developer, UX/UI Designer, Project Manager, Quality Assurance Engineer, DevOps Engineer) recognize the importance of quality at the process level, emphasizing methodologies, workflows, and efficiency in software development.
All roles agree on the significance of quality at the software level, focusing on attributes like performance, reliability, and user satisfaction in the final product.
Multiple roles (Project Manager, Quality Assurance Engineer, UX/UI Designer) highlight the attempt to define quality, indicating a shared interest in establishing clear standards and benchmarks.

Disagreed.justification: Unique to the Software Developer, this code emphasizes a technical distinction between process and software quality, which other roles do not explicitly frame as 'dimensions.'
Specific to the UX/UI Designer, this code focuses on user satisfaction as a defining factor, diverging from the more technical or managerial perspectives of other roles.
Exclusive to the DevOps Engineer, this code reflects an end-to-end integration mindset, which is not explicitly addressed by other roles.
Unique to the Quality Assurance Engineer, this code frames quality in terms of 'layers,' a granularity not mirrored by other roles.
